sentences.en: Advertising revenue in the new financial year has got off to a flying start.
sentences.cn: 广告收入在新财年取得了开门红。

sentences.en: an increase in tax revenues of 8.4%
Economic returns have further improved. National revenue has kept growing.
sentences.cn: 经济效益进一步提高,财政收入不断增长.

sentences.en: France derives 16% of revenue from air freight.
sentences.cn: 法国16%的收入来自航空货运。

sentences.en: One of the most familiar examples is the Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.cn: 人们最熟悉的例子之一是国内税务署.

sentences.en: Revenue from brown goods, including televisions and hi-fis, rose nearly 12 per cent.
sentences.cn: 包括电视机和高保真音响在内的黑色家电的销售收入增加了将近12%。

sentences.en: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.cn: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。
教会的收入来自世俗事务.

sentences.en: The Crown derived rents and other revenue.
sentences.cn: 王室收取租金和其它税收.

sentences.en: The Inland Revenue is responsible for collecting income tax.
sentences.cn: 税务局负责徵收所得税.

sentences.en: The Internal Revenue Service sought to disallow the payments.
sentences.cn: 国内收入署试图驳回这些缴纳款。

sentences.en: The reckoning up of revenue and expenditure shows a small surplus.
The revenue from tourism is the biggest single item in the country's invisible earnings.
sentences.cn: 旅游业收入是该国无形收益当中最大的一项。

sentences.en: The revenue is derived from the following sources.
They are of two main classes , protective duties and revenue duties.
sentences.cn: 关税主要有两种, 保护税和所得税.

sentences.en: We allocate 10 % of revenue to publicity.
sentences.cn: 我们拨出10%的收入做广告.

phrases.tran_cn: 营业收入帐户；岁入帐；收益帐；进款帐

trans.tran_en: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services
